relatedanime.anime: Love Kome: We Love Rice Nikisaku

anime.description: The Harvest Show is a concert where all of the different grains show off their beauty to everyone watching, and HarveStars is the name given to the grains who put on the best performances. In this modern age of rice acreage reduction policies and Westernization of eating habits, bread has become the most popular grain in Japan, and dinner tables are dominated by Yeast King, the bread HarveStars. But five new rice students have enrolled at Kokuritsu Inaho Academy, a school on the verge of shutting down, and they form a new group called Love Rice that`s practicing to beat Yeast King at the Harvest Show and win back the popularity rice once had... Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: anthropomorphism
tag.description: Anthropomorphism is the attribution of uniquely human characteristics to non-human beings, inanimate objects, or natural or supernatural phenomena. If it`s an animal or an object (AI excluded) and it speaks and/or does other human-like things (dresses up) then we`re dealing with anthropomorphism. Anthropomorphism leans more on the animal-looking side when compared to http://anidb.net/t7 [juujin], which leans more on the human-looking side.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

episode.title: そんなお前にひとめぼれ
Love at First Sight with Hitomebore
Sonna Omae ni Hitomebore
episode.summary: The three members of Love Rice are training when they spot Hitomebore hitting on someone. After seeing him so persistently trying to pick up a date even in the middle of a blizzard, Hinohikari asks him to join Love Rice, but Hitomebore says he has plans to become a comedian with Chinkobozu. Then he takes off, saying he has a date, and the Love Rice members follow him to find... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 普通の田植えはもうあきた
I`ve Had Enough of the Usual Rice Planting
Futsuu no Taue wa Mou Akita
episode.summary: Hinohikari had just grown accustomed to being a member of Nikomaru and Akitakomachi`s HarveStar unit, "Blend Mine," when the subject of Akitakomachi`s past comes up and they stumble upon a fatal flaw in Blend Mine. So the new unit name suggested by Hinohikari after he had saved it up—no, kept it warm—for a long time is "Love Rice." Meanwhile, Sasanishiki watches the three of them from afar... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニコニコ笑顔じゃいられない
Nikomaru Can`t Keep Smiling
Nikoniko Egao ja Irarenai
episode.summary: Hinohikari has decided to enter the Harvest Festival in order to start not a rice boom, but a rice riot. He asks Nikomaru, Akitakomachi, Hitomebore, Sasanishiki, and Chinkobozu to join him, but none of them are willing. Finally Nikomaru can`t bear to watch anymore and offers him a surprising suggestion, but can Hinohikari bring himself to take him up on it? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新米生徒は粒ぞろい?
The Newest Crop of Students Is Here?
Shinmai Seito wa Tsubuzuroi?
episode.summary: Somewhere in Japan is the historical school for grains, Inaho Academy. A new student there, Hinohikari, learns at the opening ceremony that the school is about to be shut down, and the only way to stop it is to beat out the bread. With that in mind, Hinohikari declares his intention in front of the whole school to become a HarveStar that surpasses even the alumni group Five Grain Rice... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新米生徒は粒ぞろい? 初回拡大スペシャル
Episode S1
Shinmai Seito wa Tsubuzuroi? Shokai Kakudai Special
腰が光ってSay Mine!
Say Mine! Koshihikari Shines
Koshi ga Hikatte Say Mine!
episode.summary: After feeling stimulated by Blast Resistance`s concert, the members of Love Rice try to work on some new moves, but they can`t seem to master the perfect technique. As they`re left confused and frustrated, Koshihikari, the leader of Five Grain Rice and an alumnus of Inaho Academy, appears before them. Hinohikari, a HarveStar otaku, is enthralled to see his idol standing in front of him, but for the sake of Love Rice, he gets serious about undergoing Koshihikari`s rigorous training... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 六つ子さん
The Sextuplets
Mutsugo-san
episode.summary: The five members of Love Rice are both excited and focused as they look ahead to their Harvest Festival appearance. Then An, Shokku, and Kyari, the hottest HarveStars from the Sacred Bread High School, arrive on the scene. After seeing their far superior Harvest Show, the girls who once cheered for Love Rice turn their attention to Yeast King. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 故郷に錦を飾るのだ
Sasanishiki Is Going Home a Hero
Kokyou ni Nishiki o Kazaru no Da
episode.summary: Sasanishiki continues to refuse the invitations to join Love Rice. Then, for some reason, there`s suddenly a train track running through the school yard, and a dog is trapped on the track as a train rushes toward it. Love Rice is frozen in place, but Sasanishiki rushes forward. Sasanishiki`s skill and drive when it comes to Harvest Shows was once said to rival Koshihikari himself, but the story Morinokuma begins to tell about his past is one nobody expected... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二期へ浪漫飛行
Romantic Flight Toward Season 2
Niki e Roman Hikou
episode.summary: Love Rice managed to overcome their crisis thanks to Chinkobozu`s Harvest Show. Rain suddenly started to fall as Love Rice made their return to the Harvest Festival venue. Will the wishes of Hinohikari, Sasanishiki, Hitomebore, Akitakomachi, and Nikomaru to restore the popularity of rice and keep the school open be granted? Can rice defeat bread? This emotional Love Kome-dy is about to reach its conclusion! Love Rice is forced to begin their Harvest Show without Hitomebore, but Yeast King sees that they`re not performing at their full potential and stops them. The members of Yeast King feel ashamed of everything they`ve done to stand in Love Rice`s way, and even more so when they find out who was behind Hitomebore`s dilemma, so they offer to help. The desire to present their Harvest Shows fair and square leads to the sprouting of friendship between the two rival grains. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: やっと出たちんこ坊主
Chinkobozu Finally Has His Turn
Yatto Deta Chinko Bouzu
episode.summary: Love Rice arrives at the Harvest Festival with the goal of starting a rice riot with their performance, which they haven`t once completed successfully in practice yet. Then Hinohikari tells the other members the reason he decided to become a HarveStar. But then the mood is broken when Hitomebore receives a phone call... Who`s behind this?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンはパンでも食えないパン
Some Breads Are Just Indigestible
Pan wa Pan demo Kuenai Pan
episode.summary: Hinohikari and Nikomaru sneak into St. Pan High School to scope it out. They end up being caught by Yeast King`s homeroom teacher, Crois, but Yeast King puts on their Harvest Show anyway, as if inviting the two of them to check out the competition. After witnessing the overwhelming difference in skill between their two groups, Hinohikari and Nikomaru can`t help but respect their rivals. Then Crois comes up with a plan... Source: crunchyroll
